ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] What's better?
ygData.msgSnippet: I will give the info I know.  Requires a High Elven smith. You need gorget plate sectional mold, 1 moonlight temper, 1 elven smithy hammer, 1 enchanted mithril
ygData.messageBody:
I will give the info I know. Requires a High Elven smith.

You need gorget plate sectional mold, 1 moonlight temper, 1 elven smithy
hammer, 1 enchanted mithril chain jointing, 1 leather padding, and 1
enchanted folded sheet of mithril.
Trivial somewhere above 225.

To make the jointing you need:

1 morning dew, 1 enchanted mithril rings, 1 elven smithy hammer, 1 file
Hammer and file returned. Trivial about 175.

To make the Enchanted mithril rings you need:

1 morning dew, 1 enchanted large brick of mithril, 1 file. Trivial < 175.
Enchanter can enchant mithril at 49, no longer requires gems to cast.

To make the enchanted folded sheet of mithril you need:

1 enchanted block of mithril, 1 morning dew, 1 elven smithy hammer

To make the enchanted block of mithril you need:

3 enchanted large bricks mithril, 1 morning dew

As you can see this is not a trivial process.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 26, 2001 10:05 AM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] What's better?


Do you know what the skill level required is? or the ingredients?

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 26, 2001 9:55 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] What's better?
>
>
> Probably the best item for a half-elf or wood-elf bard would be the
> Enchanted Koada-Dal Mithril Plate collar. It has AC 9, and
> +3 STR and +4
> Cha. Might be tough finding a smith who makes it depending
> on your server.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
> Sent: Monday, June 25, 2001 4:58 PM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] What's better?
>
>
>
> Have to agree -- until you start a serious charming career, go with
> strength. It is probably most important at lower lvls too
> because you wear
> heavier armor then.
> Stephen McCloskey <s.mccloskey@...> wrote: imho at
> level 11 it
> doesn't matter much. If you need more STR then go with
> that, else use the CHA. At 11 I was always looking for STR as I was
> wearing all bronze and heavy weapons. I didn't start trading
> in my STR for
> CHA until I was getting lighter gear.
>
> -Steve
>
> >Just got my lvl 11 bard a silver cats eye necklace insanely
> cheap (a few
> >cats eye agates and 3pp for it), then realized I already had
> a 3str item
> >in that slot... So what's better, 3 str or 3 cha?
> >
> >
> >--
> >~Umi-chan
>
